channel.title: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Read The Rulings: Inside The Same-Sex Marriage Decisions
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday struck down the Defense of Marriage Act, ruling that legally married same-sex couples are now entitled to the same federal benefits as married opposite-sex couples. They also weighed in on California's same-sex marriage ban. Read annotated versions of the rulings.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday struck down the Defense of Marriage Act, ruling that legally married same-sex couples are now entitled to the same federal benefits as married opposite-sex couples. They also weighed in on California's same-sex marriage ban. Read annotated versions of the rulings.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Court Overturns DOMA, Sidesteps Broad Gay Marriage Ruling
item.description: The Court paved the way for same-sex couples to receive federal benefits and for gay marriages to resume in California. The court, however, did not make a broad, nationwide ruling on the issue.
item.content:encoded:
The Court paved the way for same-sex couples to receive federal benefits and for gay marriages to resume in California. The court, however, did not make a broad, nationwide ruling on the issue.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Are HBCUs in Trouble? An Evergreen Question
item.description: Some tough news about several historically black colleges has prompted folks to wonder if they're viable and necessary — questions that sometimes simplify their strengths and challenges.
item.content:encoded:
Some tough news about several historically black colleges has prompted folks to wonder if they're viable and necessary — questions that sometimes simplify their strengths and challenges.

item.title: WATCH: Teary Paula Deen Says She's No Racist
item.description: "I believe that every creature on this earth... was created equal," Deen said in an interview with the Today Show.
item.content:encoded:
"I believe that every creature on this earth... was created equal," Deen said in an interview with the Today Show.

item.title: Fruity With A Hint Of Bologna: A Slacker's Guide To Wine Tasting
item.description: Science is a beautiful thing — especially when it helps you impress your foodie friends. Here we present five easy party tricks — based on science, natch — that will make you look like a wine tasting pro. Do try this at home.
item.content:encoded:
Science is a beautiful thing — especially when it helps you impress your foodie friends. Here we present five easy party tricks — based on science, natch — that will make you look like a wine tasting pro. Do try this at home.

item.title: Book News: Turkish Protesters Form 'Taksim Square Book Club'
item.description: Also: John Quincy Adams' ode to the Eurasian Bull finch; Jane Austen may be the new face on the £10 note; Barnes & Noble struggles.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Prime Minister Julia Gilliard Ousted By Kevin Rudd
item.description: Gillard was Australia's first female prime minister. She said her gender doesn't explain everything, but it "doesn't explain nothing."
item.content:encoded:
Gillard was Australia's first female prime minister. She said her gender doesn't explain everything, but it "doesn't explain nothing."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: LIVE BLOG: Court Overturns DOMA, Passes On Gay Marriage
item.description: The high court has overturned the federal Defense of Marriage Act. It has also returned California's Proposition 8 to a lower appellate court with orders to dismiss it, saying some case participants didn't have standing to bring the challenge.
item.content:encoded:
The high court has overturned the federal Defense of Marriage Act. It has also returned California's Proposition 8 to a lower appellate court with orders to dismiss it, saying some case participants didn't have standing to bring the challenge.

item.title: Archbishop Prays For 'Peaceful, Perfect End' For Nelson Mandela
item.description: The 94-year-old anti-apartheid legend and former president remains hospitalized in critical condition.
item.content:encoded:
The 94-year-old anti-apartheid legend and former president remains hospitalized in critical condition.

item.title: Clock Runs Out On Controversial Texas Abortion Bill
item.description: After a dramatic evening that included a filibuster, procedural back-and-forth and the crowds of chanting protesters in the Capitol, Texas lawmakers failed to pass sweeping abortion restrictions before a midnight deadline.
item.content:encoded:
After a dramatic evening that included a filibuster, procedural back-and-forth and the crowds of chanting protesters in the Capitol, Texas lawmakers failed to pass sweeping abortion restrictions before a midnight deadline.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Jordan Accused Of Targeting Online Dissent
item.description: It's happened across the Middle East — and now it's happening in Jordan. The country's government has cracked down on news and other Internet sites. A new law requires those sites to be registered with the government and have a member of Jordan's press council on staff. Some are calling it another form of censorship.
item.content:encoded:
It's happened across the Middle East — and now it's happening in Jordan. The country's government has cracked down on news and other Internet sites. A new law requires those sites to be registered with the government and have a member of Jordan's press council on staff. Some are calling it another form of censorship.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Old Safe Reveals Historical Relics Of Women's Suffrage Group
item.description: On the 125th anniversary of the the National Council of Women of the United States, the organization teamed up with the University of Rochester to open an old safe painted with the words: "Woman Suffrage Party." No one knew what was in the safe or when it had last been opened.
item.content:encoded:
On the 125th anniversary of the the National Council of Women of the United States, the organization teamed up with the University of Rochester to open an old safe painted with the words: "Woman Suffrage Party." No one knew what was in the safe or when it had last been opened.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Let's Separate The Schoolin' From The Sports
item.description: We in the U.S. think, nostalgically, of athletics as integral to higher education, but perhaps they're so unusual that they should be entirely separated from the academic and turned into an honest commercial adjunct.
item.content:encoded:
We in the U.S. think, nostalgically, of athletics as integral to higher education, but perhaps they're so unusual that they should be entirely separated from the academic and turned into an honest commercial adjunct.

item.title: Tina Brown's Must-Reads: On Media, The People, And Strife
item.description: The editor of The Daily Beast returns to recommend three compelling reads on the topic of the stories media tell about conflict in the world around them — and the surging force of social media, which increasingly sets the storytelling agenda.
item.content:encoded:
The editor of The Daily Beast returns to recommend three compelling reads on the topic of the stories media tell about conflict in the world around them — and the surging force of social media, which increasingly sets the storytelling agenda.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Real Estate Sizzles Again In Las Vegas
item.description: High-paying investors have helped the market to bloom in the desert city that once ranked as the foreclosure capital. Even homeowners who thought they were underwater are benefiting. One owner says her home's value increases by about $1,000 every two days. That, she says, is the craziness of Vegas.
item.content:encoded:
High-paying investors have helped the market to bloom in the desert city that once ranked as the foreclosure capital. Even homeowners who thought they were underwater are benefiting. One owner says her home's value increases by about $1,000 every two days. That, she says, is the craziness of Vegas.
